channel.title: Morning Mail
channel.description: Stay updated on the latest news and events happening in the RPI community.

item.title: Be a Part of RPI’s Premier Cybersecurity Team!
item.description: Date: Wednesday, November 13, 2024 6:00 PM - 7:00 PM - The #1 collegiate cybersecurity CTF team in the country is looking for new players, so if you’d like to be part of the Rensselaer Cybersecurity Collaboratory, just stop by Sage 3101 every Wednesday evening through the end of the semester! No experience necessary, just a willingness to learn and try new things. Contact Dr. Brian Callahan if you have questions.

item.title: Global Virtual Career Fair to be Held for LGBTQ+ Students, Recent Graduates
item.description: Date: November 13, 2024, 12:00 - 3:00 pm - Rensselaer is a proud sponsor of this year’s #WorkFair, a global virtual career fair for LGBTQ+ students and recent graduates in Europe, Asia, and the Americas. This free event will feature opportunities to attend virtual panels and workshops, engage in live chats with recruiters, and book interviews. Please visit the WorkFair website for more information and to register.

item.title: Second Economics Virtual Info Session to Be Held November 20
item.description: Join us for an online info session on our PhD in Applied Econ and Policy and MS in Econ programs on Wed, Nov 20th, at 10:00 AM. Learn about the program structures and focus areas, ideal applicants for each program, and funding opportunities. Registration is required to receive the Zoom link.

item.title: Don’t Forget Wellness Wednesdays!
item.description: Date: Wednesday, November 13, 2024 12:00 PM - 2:00 PM - A program dedicated to enhancing student health and well-being, Wellness Wednesdays offer a diverse range of activities and information sessions that focus on crucial life skills and aim to equip students with practical knowledge for maintaining physical, mental, and financial wellness throughout their college journey and beyond.

item.title: Looking for an Apartment?
item.description: Date: Wednesday, November 13, 2024 12:30 PM - 1:30 PM - All students are welcome to attend this session to learn about how to search for — and explore the considerations for selecting — an apartment, as well as get information on the resources that the Off-Campus Commons has to offer.
item.author: Students

item.title: Today is 24 for 1824 Giving Day!
item.description: Date: Tuesday, November 12, 2024 12:00 AM - Wed , November 13, 2024 12:00 AM - In honor of Founders Day and its Bicentennial, Rensselaer is hosting its annual fall Giving Day today! During these 24 hours, please consider supporting our current students while celebrating pride in RPI and 200 years of history. Please visit the 24 for 1824 Giving Day website for more information or to donate.

item.title: Administration Division: South MRC Parking Lot to Close November 13
item.description: All members of the campus community should note that, beginning Wednesday, November 13, 2024 and running through Saturday, March 15, 2025, the South MRC parking lot will be closed to support a construction project in the Polymer Center.
item.author: Community

item.title: DotCIO Tech Tip Tuesday - Box Drive - syncing configuration
item.description: Do you use Box Drive? If so, this is a very IMPORTANT tip on where you should be creating new folders and files. Box Drive will allow creation of folders, subfolders and files at the All Files level. However, these will not sync/upload to Box https://rpi.box.com and therefore, files do not show up when logging into https://rpi.box.com
item.author: Community

item.title: United Way to Host Annual Thanksgiving Feast November 21
item.description: Date: Thursday, November 21, 2024 11:30 AM - 2:00 PM - The campus community is welcome to come to Russell Sage Dining Hall to enjoy a Thanksgiving feast featuring roast turkey, ham, and all the trimmings for just $15! Vegan and gluten-free options will also be available. Reservations are required, and payment by cash, check, or departmental charge must be received by November 13. Take-out meals will also be available upon request, but no walk-ins will be accepted.

item.title: Quantum Computing Users Group Monthly Meeting Scheduled for November 13
item.description: Join students and colleagues interested in quantum computing, or those currently working on the subject, at noon on Wednesday, November 13 in Amos Eaton 214. If you are interested in presenting, please contact Tom Morgan.

item.title: Apple Says AI’s Math Skills Fall Short
item.description: Recent findings from Apple researchers have cast doubt on the mathematical prowess of large language models (LLMs), challenging the notion that artificial intelligence (AI) is on the brink of human-like reasoning. Professor Selmer Bringsjord of Rensselaer’s Cognitive Science department offers some comments in this article, which appeared in the October 18 online edition of PYMNTS.
item.author: Community

item.title: DevFest 2024 Slated for November 16
item.description: Date: Saturday, November 16, 2024 10:00 AM - 6:00 PM - Join Rensselaer’s Computer Science department for this year’s DevFest software development conference, which will feature great talks about emerging technologies around AI and other developer technologies, with speakers from all over talking about using AI in development, cloud computing, web development and machine learning.

item.title: Cognitive Science Seminar to be Held November 13
item.description: Please join the Cognitive Science Department at noon on Wednesday, November 13th in Carnegie 113, for a seminar titled “Charting a Middle Path: Beyond Dialogue Systems Dichotomies” by Dr. David Traum, Director for Natural Language Research at the Institute for Creative Technologies (ICT) and Research Professor in the Department of Computer Science at the University of Southern California (USC).

item.title: 2024 Sydney Ross Lecture in Chemistry to be Held Today
item.description: Date: Tuesday, November 12, 2024 4:00 PM - 5:00 PM - The Department of Chemistry’s seminar series continues with the 2024 Sydney Ross Lecture in Chemistry featuring Heather J. Kulik, Professor of Chemical Engineering and Chemistry at Massachusetts Institute of Chemistry, who will speak about “Machine Learning Accelerated Materials Discovery.”

item.title: “Digital Utopia and Dystopia” Topic of Talk with Mengtai Zhang
item.description: Date: Wednesday, November 13, 2024 3:00 PM - 4:30 PM - This talk by RPI alum Mengtai Zhang will explore the desire to escape into digital worlds and the fears surrounding their potential consequences through examining the phenomenon of internet addiction in China.
item.author: Community

item.title: TWed Talk, “Intro to Quantum Fourier Transform on the RPI Quantum One,” Scheduled for November 13
item.description: All are welcome to attend this special TWed Talk as guest speaker Dr. Thomas R. Morgan, Senior Scientist with the Future of Computing Institute (FOCI) at Rensselaer, leads a very applied introduction to quantum computing as he discusses the use of the Qiskit toolkit and Jupyter Notebooks on the FOCI Cluster to evaluate Fourier Transforms using the RPI Quantum One.

item.title: Virtual URP Handshake Faculty Training to be Held November 21
item.description: From 2:00PM to 3:00PM on Thursday, November 21, the CCPD will host an opportunity for faculty members to learn how to use Handshake for posting undergraduate research positions. If you can’t make it to this session but would like to be notified of future trainings, please contact Nicole Doran.

item.title: November 15 Grad Program Info Session Specifically for RPI Employees
item.description:
Date: Friday, November 15, 2024 12:00 PM - 12:30 PM - RSVP to join Rensselaer at Work’s informational webinar just for Rensselaer employees to review RPI’s part-time, online graduate programs in engineering, analytics, leadership, and technical change management. Attendees will hear about the project-based model, learning through iteration, and how RPI Instructor Mentors provide industry expertise, advice, and mentorship.
